images.copyright: Hummock ice on Lake Peipus in Estonia (© Sven Zacek/Minden Pictures)
images.title: When ice imitates art
images.caption: Lake Peipus, Estonia
images.desc: Lake Peipus, the fifth-largest lake in Europe, dates back hundreds of millions of years to the Paleozoic Era and is known for its sand dunes, which can 'sing' when the wind blows just right. In the winter the frozen lake surface may feature ice hummocks, as seen in this image. The hummocks are caused by slow, uneven pressure in the ice pack.

tooltips.walle: This image is not available to download as wallpaper.
